page.title: 05SOUTH CERNEY ARMY CAMP(CONT)
page.content: We where shown around the camp by the Adjutant, Captain Mike Rees, whose photograph is included with this survey. He was 21 years old when he came to South Cerney, and has enjoyed his time here, as his work is exciting, different and busy. His hobby is shooting on Military ranges, where he has a variety of weapons. We also met the Leiutenant Colonel in the No2 Postal and Courier detachment of the Royal Engineers. They played an important role in the Falklands War, when they transported a massive amount of forces mail to and from the South Atlantic.
